The deck has a curved shape at both ends, known as the nose (front) and the tail (back), which assist in performing tricks. The top surface of the deck often has a layer of grip tape, which is a gritty, sandpaper-like covering that helps provide traction to the rider's shoes.

2. **Trucks**: These are the metal T-shaped mechanisms attached to the underside of the deck. Trucks are pivotal in the turning mechanism of the skateboard. They are attached to the deck via special bolts called hardware and have bushings, which are rubber-like rings that allow the board to turn smoothly when the rider leans side to side.

This sediment can be derived from the weathering and erosion of preexisting rocks or the accumulation of biological debris, such as shells and plant material.
